Hi, my name is
Austin Hochhalter.
I'm a Software Developer.







about me

Hello! I'm Austin, a software developer from Sioux Falls, SD. I'm currently writing production level web applications at Daktronics, while also being a full time student at South Dakota State University.

My passion for developing software spawned from my love of computers and video games as a child. Today, I feed my passion by learning new programming techniques and consistently perfecting my existing knowledge of all things software.

  • Pascal
  • Fortran

Skills

  • Knowledgeable in Git and Azure DevOps
  • Experienced with agile development processes, specifically SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)
  • Familiar with using Unity to code 3D games
  • Skilled with frameworks such as ASP.NET Core, Angular, Ionic, and Xamarin

experience

Daktronics, Brookings, SD
Software Developer, September 2018 to Present

  • Writing production level web applications using ASP.NET Core, C#, Typescript, and MVVM architecture as a student on Daktronics IT Software Development teams.
  • Currently on a team developing and maintaining large scale features for existing Daktronics developed web applications used by HR. Involved with planning and developing new Daktronics applications as well.
  • Have primarily worked on back-end business logic code handling large pools of employee data and UI Design.
  • Implemented file upload validators used to preserve data integrity in an employee pay data web application. Created the necessary tables, scripts and controllers. Designed the file upload section on the UI.

Rise United Media, Brookings, SD
Software Developer, September 2019 to Present

  • Currently in a group helping Rise United develop their mobile focused social media application as a senior design capstone project. Implementation will be completed using Xamarin.

South Dakota State University
Teacher's Assistant, August 2019 to December 2019

  • Helped computer science freshmen learn how to code in SDSU's Intro to Computer Science Lab using Unity to implement a basic game. My job mostly involved helping students with issues in their code, but also included general college and computer science questions as well.
